meanings.definition: To work on or make changes to something that has already been done.
meanings.sent1: I need to rework my essay to fix the mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She decided to rework the painting to add more details.
meanings.sent3: After the cake collapsed, she had to rework it into cake pops.
meanings.sent4: He had to rework his schedule to fit in the new meeting.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to rework the dress to make it fit perfectly.

meanings.definition: To revise or improve upon something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked me to rework my essay for a better grade.
meanings.sent2: He always takes the time to rework his drawings until they are perfect.
meanings.sent3: She had to rework her recipe after burning the first batch of cookies.
meanings.sent4: The team had to rework their strategy to win the game.
meanings.sent5: The designer had to rework the logo to make it more appealing.

meanings.definition: To redo or alter a task or project.
meanings.sent1: I had to rework the presentation after the slides got mixed up.
meanings.sent2: They decided to rework the garden layout for better sunlight exposure.
meanings.sent3: He had to rework his speech after forgetting an important point.
meanings.sent4: The architect had to rework the building plans due to new regulations.
meanings.sent5: She had to rework the budget to accommodate unexpected expenses.
